listing.name: Redmine Sync (RedSync)
listing.description:
# üéØIntroduction

RedSync integrates Redmine and Trello, combining Redmine's excellent project management features with Trello's user-friendly task management capabilities. This enables close communication between project managers and team members, allowing for better understanding and control of project status.

Through this integration:

-   Project members can check schedules and report progress on Trello cards.
-   Project managers can deploy schedules and collect progress updates through Trello cards.

Additionally, RedSync offers features not found in standard Redmine, such as GUI editing of Gantt charts and integration with external users who do not have Redmine accounts.

![Integration Image](https://pvision.jp/apps/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/redsync-system-to-be.png)

# ‚ú®How Does Integration Work?

Integration is achieved by synchronizing Redmine tickets with Trello cards, effectively turning Trello into a client for Redmine.

This synchronization occurs as follows:

-   Trello cards are created from Redmine tickets.
-   Upon ticket updates after card creation, those changes are reflected on the cards.
-   Progress entered on cards is reflected back to the tickets.

The following image shows an example of Trello cards synchronized with Redmine tickets. Project members can refer to and update task information such as arrangements and work results while confirming schedules and reporting progress during daily work as requested by project managers.
![Synced Card](https://pvision.jp/power-ups/redsync-doc/synced-card-en.png)

As another collaborative feature, project managers can display and edit Gantt charts directly on Trello. The editing ability with drag-and-drop especially enhances efficiency for project managers. 
For team members, viewing the Gantt chart enables them to understand the progress of preceding tasks, helping them plan their work schedules or make necessary adjustments with owners of subsequent tasks.

![Gantt Chart](https://pvision.jp/power-ups/redsync-doc/gantt-chart-en.png)

  **Details:**
[üìñUser Guide](https://pvision.jp/apps/2022/03/17/redsync-power-up/)
[üìöReferences](https://pvision.jp/apps/redsync-references/)
 
# ‚ú®Major Features

**üìåCreate Trello Cards from Redmine Issues**

You can associate a Trello Board with a Redmine Project and sync the project to the board to create Trello cards from Redmine issues. Whenever you change the issue schedules, you can sync them again to update the card schedules.

**üìåReport Status and Progress from Trello Card to Redmine Issue**

You can report the status and progress from a Trello card to a Redmine issue. In addition, you can update Tracker, Priority, Category, etc.

[üéûÔ∏èDemo](https://pvision.jp/power-ups/redsync-doc/redsync-demo-sync-en.mp4)

**üìåReview Schedule and Progress on Gantt Chart on Trello**

You can review the schedule and progress on the Gantt chart on Trello.

[üéûÔ∏èDemo](https://pvision.jp/power-ups/redsync-doc/redsync-demo-gantt-view-en.mp4)

**üìåCreate and update Schedule on Gantt Chart on Trello**

You can create new tasks or update the start/due dates of the existing tasks on the Gantt chart on Trello.

[üéûÔ∏èDemo](https://pvision.jp/power-ups/redsync-doc/redsync-demo-gantt-edit-en.mp4)  

**üìåCollaborate with External Users**

A shared API key is a Redmine API key assigned to a dummy user and used to access Redmine from Trello. Using the shared API key, you can collaborate with external users who do not have Redmine accounts. The external user does not have a user ID or password on Redmine, so the user does not access Redmine directly.

# ‚ú®Other Features

**üìåReport Work Time on Card**

You can report work time to a Redmine issue from a Trello card. You can view, edit, and delete work time as well.

**üìåInput Data to Redmine Custom Fields on Card**

You can map Trello's custom fields and Redmine's custom fields. With this mapping, you can input data to the Redmine custom fields from a card or review the value of Redmine custom fields on a card.

**üìåSort Trello List with Issue's Priority**

You can sort the Trello cards on a List with the Redmine issues' priority.

**üìåFilter Cards by Issue's Content**
**üìåTrigger a Workflow by Issue's Change**

You can filter Trello cards by a Redmine issue field (i.e., Track, Status, Progress, Category, Assignee) or a Redmine custom field mapped to a Trello custom field. Using the mapped custom field, you can also trigger a Redmine workflow (Butler).

[üéûÔ∏èDemo](https://pvision.jp/power-ups/redsync-doc/redsync-demo-workflow-en.mp4) 

# ‚ú®Plans

RedSync has three plans. The Pro Plan is a subscription to a board for $5/Boad/Month. A project requires a board. There is no charge to individual users.

Refer to [Plans](https://pvision.jp/apps/2022/06/15/redsync-free-version-vs-pro-version/)

**üìåFree Plan**

- Create and update Trello's Cards from Redmine's Issues.
- Display the Gantt chart on Trello and review the entire schedule.
- Requires to make the reporting on Redmine directly. RedSync provides a link to a Redmine issue on a Card so you can open the Issue to report.

**üìåPro Plan**
In addition to the Free Plan:

- Report the status and progress on a Card. They are reported to Redmine immediately. Complete the reporting on Trello without accessing Redmine.
- Edit the Gantt chart by drag-and-drop to define and update WBS and schedule instantly.
- Access to a Redmine server without CORS support via RedSync proxy.

**üìåPersonal Plan**

It has the same features as Pro Plan, but the number of board members is limited to one.

**üí≤Optimize Cost**

Switching between the Free and Pro Plans allows you to pay only for what you need. For instance, you can use the Pro Plan during the peak period of the project for frequent reporting and switch back to the Free Plan after that period.

# ü§©Try RedSync

**Start with Free Plan**

You can start using the Free Plan for your project right now.

**Evaluate/Use Personal Plan**

You can evaluate/use the Personal Plan, which supports the full functions like the Pro Plan. However, the number of board members is limited to one.

**Evaluate Pro Plan**

You can evaluate the Pro Plan with Optro's seven-day free trial. (See the Subscription section below for Optro.)

In both cases, the Redmine server must support HTTPS, which most servers have done. Refer to [Administrator's Guide](https://pvision.jp/apps/2022/03/17/redsync-power-up/#user-guide-en-administrators-guide) for the system requirements.

# üõ´Subscription

The Pro plan is available on the [Optro](https://optro.cloud/) marketplace. Optro provides a seven-day free trial to ensure the Pro plan meets your needs.

[Make it Pro with Optro](https://optro.cloud/app/617c2d2289d99f306863e8fa)

# ü™õSystem Requirements

Redmine
Version: 4.1, 4.2, 5.0 or heigher
Protocol:
- HTTPS
- CORS (Optional)

Browser
Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge

# ü§ùSupport

We provide RedSync power-up on an "as-is" basis with Q&A support only.

Please submit any questions or defects to GitHub:
[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/pvisionjp/redsync/blob/main/README.md)

We welcome your feedback and feature suggestions. Please submit them to GitHub as well.

listing.name: Agile Story Maps by StoriesOnBoard
listing.description:
It‚Äôs time to organize endless Trello lists into a story map and see the big picture of your product. StoriesOnBoard improves product planning by visually providing a high-level overview of product vision, features and dependencies. Give context to the dev team by visualizing all the crucial backlog information on the Trello card. Take release planning to the next level by crafting releases using drag and drop. 

![Roadmap your product](https://storiesonboard.com/images/trellopowerup/graphic1.png)


## How StoriesOnBoard supports product management

‚úÖCreate user personas
‚úÖMap user journeys
‚úÖCollect backlog items (without flooding the Trello board)
‚úÖSpecify stories (easy-to-use text editor, labels, tags, attachment, estimations, comments)
‚úÖStrategic overview of the product (use it for product discussions or sharing product strategy)
‚úÖCollaborate with stakeholders (invite them for free)
‚úÖPlan releases or sprints (prioritize and move items by drag and drop)
‚úÖTrack the dev process (real-time status sync)
‚úÖStreamline your workflow (map statuses, push items release by release to the Trello board)

## Features

üñáÔ∏èReal-time, two-way card title and description sync
üñáÔ∏èReal-time updated status changes
üñáÔ∏èDirect link to StoriesOnBoard attachments
üñáÔ∏èBacklog information on the Trello card (epic, step, release)
üñáÔ∏èSynced estimations
üñáÔ∏èDirect links (to cards or to the story map)

## Perks

üéÅFree Online Academy Course - User Story Mapping Basics
üéÅFree eBook - 50+ hints for story mapping, 100+ user story examples
üéÅUser Story Map Examples


![Give context to the Trello card](https://storiesonboard.com/images/trellopowerup/graphic2.png)
![Synchronize the details](https://storiesonboard.com/images/trellopowerup/graphic3.png)
![Track progression in real time](https://storiesonboard.com/images/trellopowerup/graphic4.png)
![Create user personas](https://storiesonboard.com/images/trellopowerup/graphic5.png)
![Collaborate with stakeholders](https://storiesonboard.com/images/trellopowerup/graphic6.png)

# Proposal 1

---

Would it be a good idea to have a feature that allows a user generate and export their stats and activities over a custom date range?

## Input Fields

---

- Date range
- Download format: `pdf`, `csv`

## Rules

---

- Date range should be required
- User must choose a date
- User must choose a download format

## Other Information

---

- Filter by: `date`,  `download format`

card.desc:
## System Activities

- Initialize git server
- Configure repository
- Install Express
- Initialize database

---

## Rules

- Must use NPM or Yarn for package management
- Node 20.10.0 LTS and a recent version of Express
- An appropriate database (e.g SQLITE) minimum of 20 records with realistic data
- Documentation comments added for each endpoint created using APIDOC or equivalent + generated APIDOC site
- Use of GIT/SCM with appropriate branches for all features and commits
- Remember to commit and push changes. Better to have multiple commits so we can track changes effectively.
- All endpoints should return JSON
